All_symptoms: Acute motor axonal neuropathy Central venous catheterisation Diplegia Flavivirus test negative Gait disturbance
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient was diagnosed with Acute Guillain-Barre Syndrome.  She had a weak ankle on Tuesday, 10/12/2021 and saw a physical therapist who referred her to another PT the next day.  On 10/13/2021, she collapsed getting out of bed with weakness in her legs.  She saw PT, who referred her to a neurologist, who then sent her to the ER for an MRI, who then sent her to Hospital for that MRI.  The MRI happened early morning of 10/14/2021.  It showed inflammation consistent with GBS so they put her under to install a central line and do a spinal tap.  By hen, she was only able to move her head a couple inches.  No movement in her arms and legs, but there was pain everywhere.  The tests came back verifying GBS and the Neurologist said it was Acute Motor Axonal Neuropathy. Plasmapheresis began the evening of 10/14/2021 (7 bottles) and IVIG right after.  Patient had a total of 5 treatments of plasmapheresis over 10 days, every other day (Thursday, Saturday, Monday, Wednesday and Friday).  IVIG then followed on Saturday and another Sunday. Patient worked with PT and OT every day after movement started again.  She worked on standing the Friday of the last plasmapheresis, worked on walking with a walker on Saturday and Sunday and could walk on her own a little Monday.   She will be working on walking more each day and start outpatient PT at hospital TIRR on November 8, 2021. Please note, patient is 15 and the youngest Studio Company  This is really effecting her and her future job opportunities that she has been training for since she was 2 years old!
LAB_DATA: I was told she was tested for Wast Nile, Zika and other pathogens that  have been shown to set off the GBS.  She was negative to all.  The MRI showed no structural issues, only the inflammation consistent with GBS.

All_symptoms: Blood glucose Computerised tomogram Electrocardiogram Heart rate Investigation
SYMPTOM_TEXT: seizure; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). A 13-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (COMIRNATY; Lot Number: 301558A), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 15Oct2021 between 3:15-3:20PM (at the age of 13-years-old) as dose 1, single for COVID-19 immunisation.  Medical history included allergic to penicillin. Historical vaccine included HPV vaccine on 28Aug2021. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced seizure on 15Oct2021. It was reported that patient received the first dose of the Pfizer BioNTech Covid-19 Vaccine on 15Oct2021, and within 7 minutes, experienced a seizure. The patient not prone to seizures and has never experienced a seizure before. Patient's twin brother experienced no problems after vaccination, but the reporter noted that his twin was 120 pounds, while her son who seized was only 74 pounds. She explained her son was standing up with her. The went and got the vaccine. The pharmacist told them to wait 15 minutes so she went and checked out a few items at the grocery store and came back. Her other twin son was perfectly fine. Her son, the patient, asked if he could sit on the floor and she told him no because the floor was dirty and there were no seats available. Then, her son was saying what if I did this as he laid back and she thought he was joking at first, but his eyes started rolling back and his body was twitching. He was unresponsive. Another person saw this and had the pharmacist call. There was a lovely retired nurse doing some grocery shopping and the retired nurse had checked his pulse and his breathing and everything was okay. The patient had a CT scan, EKG, and everything seems to be clear. They were admitted into the Emergency Room, but patient was never admitted into the hospital. She mentions they checked his blood sugar and that was it. Everything seemed to be fine. He was discharged from the ER. The event required also physician office visit. The reporter stated also that people were saying maybe he fainted seeing the needle, but she would think if he fainted it would have happened rather quickly after the injection and not 7 minutes afterwards. Plus, her son was not scared of needles. He said that the COVID shot didnt hurt as bad as the HPV shot he had back in August. The outcome of event was recovered on an unspecified date in Oct2021.

All_symptoms: Blood test abnormal Dehydration Headache Illness Inflammatory marker increased
SYMPTOM_TEXT: He started complaining with a headache on Sunday afternoon. He had a slight fever Sunday night. Monday morning he had a fever and started throwing up. The fever increased. I took him to see his pediatrician on Tuesday, he still had the same symptoms. His fever was 104.5 when I took him to the doctor. The doctor did a flu, covid, strep tests. All negative. They gave him ibuprofen while we were there. Also some medication for nauseas. They also did blood work and they said his inflammatory markers and white blood cells were elevated. We went back to see the pediatrician the next day because he was not feeling well. He repeated the blood work and it was still the same. He recommended to go to the local hospital because he needed fluids for dehydration. We went to the hospital and they ended up admitting him and he stayed there until 10/24/2021. When he was first admitted they thought he had MSC, but they did a Covid antibody test and it was negative. They ended up treating him for tick illness. They gave him doxycycline for that. We do not know if that is what he had for sure. He also received the flu shot on 09/21/2021.
LAB_DATA: Flu, covid, strep tests, all negative. Blood work, inflammatory markers and white blood cells were elevated. Covid antibody test, negative

All_symptoms: Blood creatine phosphokinase Blood urine present Chromaturia Complement factor C3 Complement factor C4
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Vaccine given Monday 8/30/21. On Tuesday  anticipated side effects of second vaccine evident but appeared worse than expected. Unknown at the time Urine was turning brown and cloudy. Wednesday 13 year old appeared to be recovering from day after side effects. Friday September 3, 2021 went to an Urgent Care Facility for Pink Eye. Daughter mentioned to the doctor her urine was looking funny. Doctor took a urine sample and immediately told us to go to the Emergency Room tests needed to be done.  Medical Center tests were conducted showing  Cloudy and Brown Urine with significantly elevated levels of Protein Qualitative 100 and a large amount of blood in her urine.  Ultrasound showed normal . Dr. treated as infection.  Next week no change or improvement in urine so we went to Pediatrician, same test results and culture returned negative. Suspected Nephritis.  Tired to schedule appoint with Nephrologist earliest was middle of October.  Went to emergency room at UMMC same test results. Nephrologist sent us home kept doctor vist for October 5. Same results. Awaiting next Doctor visit 11/11/2021

All_symptoms: Chest X-ray abnormal Chest pain Dyspnoea Headache Heart rate decreased
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Severe chest pain, swelling in the chest closing the airway, lower heart rate, severe headache, and nausea. We went to the ER the day after and it got severe she could barley breathe, she said it felt as she was slowly dyeing,  she was given a high nebulizer in the ER and then she was given an injection of dexamethasone. X-rays were taken of the chest and the swelling had been noticed.   She slowly came out of it but not completely she was on high nebulizers for at least 3/4 month and then she moved to the lower dose, she is now off of them completely. She then carried around an inhaler for quite some time, she still runs into complication sometimes after going on long runs, but is overall healthy.  She started taking TB4- frag which has seem to help her run longer distances. The nausea has gone away 6 weeks ago and was prescribed Prilosec  and Zofran. Under propofol her heart was then noticed to go down to 30 for a short period, she's always had a very good heart rate but was never that low. She has and been directed not to get the second dose by Dr., and if needed a note would be written.
LAB_DATA: Mono blood test, came back negative.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: To Whom it may concern  Hello CDC, This is regarding our daughter. She had heart inflammation and heart block after taking Pfizer Vaccine on 14th May and this case was already reviewed by another department so we are not including all the technical details again here. Pfizer is the only foreign object went into her body and we were staying inside our home during the vaccine period.   We are very concerned at the moment as we are not sure whether to take additional vaccine or keep ourselves isolated as our daughter has not yet taken the 2nd vaccine. We need some guidance on the next steps please. Could you please help ?  Our daughter got into syncope episode just before bed time so we were able to  rush her to nearby emergency otherwise should would have died,    This news has been spreading on social media and we are trying our very best to avoid press requests as we keep getting calls from media about this incident. We are just worried about our daughter and trying to take the next best steps with CDC help.   Concerned Parents

Mom caught the daughter and gently put her on the floor. She yelled out help the intern and the pharmacist went out to help with the situation. All_symptoms: Abdominal pain Chest pain Dyspnoea Headache Hypersomnia
SYMPTOM_TEXT: 1st dose: on the second day 7/10, patient has a fever, headache, then he complains about chest pain and difficulty breathing. He describes the chest pain as the two bullets shooting through the two sides of the chest. He takes rest for more than a week.  2nd dose: on the second day 7/31/21, patient has a fever, neck pain, and headache. He slept for more than 24 hours. After he wakes up, he complains he has chest pain and difficulty breathing. Since then he has had chest pain and difficulty breathing till now.  About 6 pm on Oct. 27, 2021, patient faints during the swimming practice. At about 11:30 am on 10/28/21, he experiences severe abdominal pain at school and is sent back home earlier. Since then he is very ill and has not been able to return to school. On the night of 11/5/2021, he runs less than 1/2 miles and he experiences faints again.
LAB_DATA: We brought him to see an after-hour pediatrician on 10/29/21 and referred him to ED. On 11/2/2021, I brought him to see his PCP. ED is referring him to see a cardiologist.

We monitored for a few minutes and he seemed to fade in and out of consciousness. No signs of anaphylaxis were noted. I asked the mother if she wanted me to alert EMS. Store management and 911 were called. The patient was transported to the hospital.

All_symptoms: Abdominal pain lower Anaemia C-reactive protein increased Chills Condition aggravated
SYMPTOM_TEXT: 13 y.o. 7 m.o. female with mild anemia, presenting with fever > 100.4 F , headache, redness of eyes and body pain for 6 days, nausea, abdominal pain and cough for 4 days and one episode of emesis yesterday. Patient was in her usual state of health till 5/17 (Monday) when she developed fever. Fever occurred everyday, mostly in the morning and night, relieved with Ibuprofen (Advil) but would recur in the night or AM, Tmax 102 F, last fever episode at home associated with chills. Patient reports headache, body pain and redness of eyes whenever she has an episode of fever. Headache is bilateral, frontal, 3/10 with no radiation or photophobia/aura, relieved when fever resolves and occurs only with fever. Redness of eyes and myalgia was intermittent only with fever onset and resolves once afebrile. She developed cough, nausea, and abdominal pain since 5/19 (Wednesday). Cough was intermittent, throughout the day, non-productive, no shortness of breath or URI symptoms associated. Abdominal pain in the lower abdomen, 3/10, non-radiating, not associated with food intake, relieved once fever resolves. Patient had one episode of NBNB emesis yesterday, associated with three loosish stools with no blood or mucus. As per mother her appetite was reduced but was adequate and she had reduced activity during the course of illness. She received her first dose of Pfeizer Covid 19 vaccination on 5/16 at 4 pm in pharmacy.   Of note, patient was also tested positive for COVID 19 on April 8th 2021 with symptoms of fever and cough and was subsequently tested negative on April 18th, along with her mother and elder sister, father tested negative.
LAB_DATA: Hospitalization: 5/22/21-5/26/21 (p.39 hospital course--no complications/PICU stay). Given history of fever > 100.4 F for 6 days, Age < 21 yrs, > 2 system involvement, with elevated CRP and recent COVID exposure with positive antibodies, patient fulfills 3/4 criteria for MISC as per CDC criteria.

All_symptoms: Acute respiratory failure Blood culture negative Chest X-ray abnormal Computerised tomogram thorax abnormal Cough
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient received vaccine in afternoon 11/4. At 2300 on 11/5, developed some congestion and an acute coughing episode productive of pinkish phlegm. Family gave some eucalyptus syrup which she was able to swallow.  Cough suddenly stopped at which point patient became nonresponsive with color change. 911 called, brought to Medical Center. Noted to be hypoxic and have barking cough. Developed acute hypoxemic respiratory failure requiring emergency intubation and she was transferred to Medical Center where she has remained on a ventilator.
LAB_DATA: Respiratory panel + for rhinovirus/enterovirus. Cultures of blood and secretions are negative. CXRs with bilateral ground glass opacities and CT with consolidation (11/6). No evidence of pulmonary embolism. Echocardiogram normal (11/7). Patient has been seen by ID and Pulmonology Services. Testing for TB (quantiferon) and Coccidioidomycosis are pending. She will undergo bronchoscopy 11/9 for concern for alveolar hemorrhage.
HISTORY: Autism Deafness Cochlear implant in place

All_symptoms: Crying Eye pain Fall Headache Muscle twitching
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Client is a 9 yr old female here with her mother for her first covid vaccine. She was very nervous at the time of her vaccine administration at 1645. She was given crackers to eat. At 1648, a loud thud was heard from outside her exam room. PNP entered the room and saw patient face down on the floor. Family member picked her up and laid her on the exam table. She was noted to be pale and crying loudly. HR in the 80s. She was monitored for several minutes attempting to get her to slow her breathing. As she stopped crying, she complained of headache all over and felt like her ""stomach was bleeding."" As she calmed down more, she also complained of right eye pain, left hip pain. She stated her abdomen did not feel strange any longer. She began twitching of her arms and legs intermittently. SHe was offered water, which she was able to drink some of. She did not like the ginger ale so would not drink that. Her Vitals remained stable with HR 89, BP 100/70, O2 SAT 98 on room air. She was rechecked frequently without significant change in her mental status or exam. She was answering questions appropriately.
LAB_DATA: I have discussed the findings and the course of the event with mother. I have discussed that she can likely take her home and feed her and monitor over the next few hours to see how she does vs taking her to the ER for IV fluids and evaluation now. Mother elects to take her to the ED  now for further evaluation. I have notified the ER and discussed emergency precautions with mother. I will report to agency. Follow up as directed.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Myocarditis, presenting with chest pain and positive troponin and cardiac MRI meeting diagnostic criteria with LGE and T2 edema
LAB_DATA: MRI 8/3: LV function is normal (EF= 54%), LV size is normal (EDV = 94 ml/m2). There is a focal area of T2 edema and delayed enhancement involving the inferolateral wall of LV, consistent with myocarditis.  MRI 11/1: LV function is mildly decreased (EF= 51%, previously 54%), LV size is mildly decreased (EDV = 81 ml/m2). There has been an interval resolution of T2 edema, however minimal residual delayed enhancement involving the inferolateral wall of LV is again seen, significantly improved since the previous examination.

All_symptoms: Basedow's disease Chest pain Electrocardiogram ambulatory abnormal Extrasystoles Heart rate increased
SYMPTOM_TEXT: During Cross Country Race on October 2nd, Pt's heart began to race and skip to the point where he complained of chest pain and had to drop out of the race . He was taken to the the local ED. Subsequently he was referred on to Pediatric Cardiologist for a Holter Monitor on October 5th and follow up on October 11th. Resting and Activity Heartrate was  way too high. Dr  ordered thyroid test which revealed Elevated Thyroid Levels suggesting Graves Disease. Dr  placed Pt on a Beta Blocker. Second Dr  ordered additional Thyroid tests including Nuclear Medicine Thyroid uptake scan and referred pt on to a third dr the Endocrinologist.  third Dr confirmed Graves Disease at appointment on November 4th. Pt is now starting to take medication for hyperthyroid/Graves Disease. At this point in time he still has elevated heart rate and is limited in his ability to participate in sports.

All_symptoms: Dizziness Dyspnoea Loss of consciousness Nausea Pruritus
SYMPTOM_TEXT: At 5:16pm the patient received 0.2mL of the Pediatric Pfizer vaccine. At 5:20pm the patient lost consciousness. The father grabbed the patient as he was falling to the ground and gently laid him on the ground. The father carried the patient to the cot. The patient reported feeling dizzy and nauseous. The patient denied any pain. The head of the bed was elevated. The patient denied any trouble breathing. At 5:24pm the patient's BP was 90/62 and HR was 110. At 5:24pm the patient vomited. At 5:24pm EMS was called. At 5:29pm the patient reported that he no longer felt dizzy. The patient was asked if he was itchy anywhere and he reported that his back was itchy. The back was assessed and hives were present across his back. The patient's parents reported that the patient has a history of breaking out in hives. The patient reported that his back was itchy before receiving the vaccine. At 5:31pm BP was 102/72 and RR 13. The fire department arrived at 5:35pm and assumed care of the patient. SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient received the first Pfizer shot on 8/4/21 the second was on 8/25/21. On 9/25/21 a seizure took place. Patient has NO history of seizures. On 10/23/21 patient had second seizure. The first seizure witnesses stated that she went into a swimming pool and then started seizing. The second seizure patient was at her birthday party at a bowling alley and mom noticed patient sitting down with her head turned over her right shoulder. Mom shouted patients name several times (no response from patient) and mom walked over to see patient, and eyes pulled over to the side. Patient's body started seizing, eyes rolled, patient making noises and foam coming out. This lasted about 1 1/2 minutes. Paramedics were called and patient was taken to Hospital and was kept under observation. Patient once again has no history of seizures and has always been healthy.  Notes: the first seizure on 09/25/21 was in the PM. Second seizure on 10/23/21 was in the PM.  Patient has an EEG scheduled on 11/2/21.

LAB_DATA: Initial TTE - 11/10/21  Summary   * Structurally normal heart.   * Moderate tricuspid regurgitation.   * Moderate mitral regurgitation.   * Normal RV pressures based on TR jet velocity and septal contour.   * Normal LV size and wall thickness though moderately depressed systolic function (mmode SF 26%, mmode EF 49%, 2D EF 42%, Bullet EF 42%).   * Trivial pericardial effusion posteriorly, along RV free wall.  Echo 11/11/21 - Summary   * Patient with history of ECMO placement (November 10, 2021). Transesophageal echocardiogram to evaluate ECMO cannulae.   * Globally qualitatively severely depressed biventricular systolic function.   * Aortic cannula tip is in mid ascending aorta.   * Trivial+ aortic insufficiency.   * Moderate mitral valve regurgitation from central coaptation defect.   * Venous cannula tip in the RA and IVC junction.  11/10/21 - SARS-CoV-2 antibodies negative; Respiratory panel negative; Lyme screen negative

All_symptoms: Immune thrombocytopenia SARS-CoV-2 test
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Thrombocytopenia - ITP; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A non-pregnant 13-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for Injection; Lot Number: FF8841, Expiration Date was not reported), intramuscularly on 06Oct2021 (at the age of 13-years-old) as dose 1, single for COVID-19 immunisation. Patient had no relevant medical history and known allergies. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19; and since the vaccination, has been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced thrombocytopenia - ITP on 06Oct2021. The patient was hospitalized for thrombocytopenia - ITP for 2 days on an unspecified date. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included SARS-COV-2, NAA, CEpheid (Nasal Swab): negative on 30Oct2021. Event resulted to Emergency room/department or urgent care and in patient receiving IVIG as treatment. The outcome of event was recovering. Patient was reported to also received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for Injection; Lot Number: FF8841, Expiration Date was not reported), intramuscularly on 27Oct2021 (at the age of 13-years-old) as dose 2, single for COVID-19 immunisation.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association, the causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the event immune thrombocytopenia cannot be excluded. The information available in this report is limited and does not allow a medically meaningful assessment. This case will be reassessed once additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.
LAB_DATA: Test Date: 20211030; Test Name: SARS-COV-2, NAA, CEpheid (Nasal Swab); Test Result: Negative
HISTORY: Comments: List of non-encoded Patient Relevant History: Patient Other Relevant History 1: none, Comment: Other medical history: None  Known allergies: None

He walked out of the room while I was giving his brother a vaccine. A few minutes later my technician told me patient had passed out at the U-scan in store and was at the little clinic next door. The store manager was aware of incident as well. Parents did not want us to contact ambulance and wanted to take the kids home. Patient was very upset about his vaccine and was crying. Parents think he hit his head when he had syncopal episode. This whole incident happened around noon. Syncope happened within 5-10 minutes of injection. I spoke with the dad around 2pm and he said they are taking patient to hospital because after a nap, patient vomited a little around 1:30pm. They are taking him just in case he has a concussion from the fall.

Pt was standing when he started decorticate posturing and drooling while being held by the mother. After the seizure, Pt was post ictal and was having difficulty realizing where he was. Pt was breathing normally, pale, and was A&Ox2. Pt started regaining consciousness and noticed his mother and started calming down. Pt vitals were taken on scene. Pt BP: 60/24, HR: 60, and 97 % on room air. 911 was contacted. Upon arrival, report was given to EMS and EMS did a full assessment and placed the Pt on the monitor. After Pt was evaluated, and vitals were taken, Pt parents opted from transporting their son to the ER via ambulance and decided drive him to the hospital on their own.

All_symptoms: Head discomfort Headache Vertigo
SYMPTOM_TEXT: On November 14, 2021 at 3:45pm my daughter stated that she felt a strong amount of pressure in her head.  She described the pressure  and pain similar to a headache.  She stated a short time later that she felt like everything was spinning around her.  When given a dose of Tylenol she stated that it slowed it down but she still felt like she was spinning.  She went to bed on Sunday evening and woke up Monday morning November 15, 2021 stating that her symptoms were the same feeling a spinning motion and pressure in her head.  She again was given Tylenol which she stated again made the feeling slightly go away but still present.  When I contacted her Primary Care Physician she stated that it would be best to go to the local Emergency Room for a further evaluation.  At the Emergency room she was evaluated and a Neurological Physical Assessment was done by the ER doctors.  At this time she had no remarkable signs of any significant neurological deficits.  She was discharged and we were told to follow up if symptoms persisted.  As of 9:16am on November 16, 2021 she is still stating that she has the same head pressure and spinning feeling.

One week later - by 11/11/2021 she was spiking fever up to 103 degrees.  On Saturday 11/13/2021 this happens again and on Sunday 11/14 we took her to Urgent Care. LAB_DATA: Pt had blood tests, urine tests, a chest x-ray, and monitoring for many hours.  No apparent reason for her having the headaches and high temperature and chills was found.  The doctor said he could not say and this was probably extended events from the vax. TODAY she is still having bouts of high fever and chills with body aches that are making her cry.  No explanation is available.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Started to get hives in October. Brought my daughter to ER. Administered Benadryl pills but got worse. Next, they infused her with dexamethosone, famotidine, diphenhydramine. It calmed the hives down. ER sent us home with Prednisone and famotidine. Next day, she got hives again. Went to the ER again, but hive started going away while waiting so we left. That night hives returned but only at her feet. She slept through it. Woke up the next day with hives again. Met with her Immunologist that day and told to take Zyrtec. Hives went away within a day. Continued on Zyrtec AM and PM and famotidine for a week. Following week, Zyrtec AM and PM only. Following week, Zyrtec AM only. Following week, no medicine. 3 days following her last dose of Zyrtec, she broke out into hives again + bad eczema flare up. Put her back on Zyrtec to calm it down. She did lab work today ordered by her immunologist - 8 vials of blood. Will get her results in a week.
LAB_DATA: Had lab work down today 11/16/21, pending a week for results

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient started developing a cough on Saturday, November 13 around 7:45 PM.  She started fevering, having body aches, and an upset stomach Sunday, November 14 around 2:30 PM.  On Monday, November 15, she early in the morning, she started throwing up.  She decided to stay home from school.  Late that morning, we called into her doctors office to see if she should be seen and if they had an appointment.  They wanted her to be seen but didn't have any available times to be seen that day and instructed us to go to an urgent care clinic.  Upon doing so, they checked her out, said all her vitals were good, ran a rapid strep test, and a 3-in-1 Flu, Covid, and RSV test.  The strep test, Covid test, and Flu test all came back as negative.  The RSV test came back positive.  As such, there was no adverse reaction to the vaccine, and instead, she had come down with RSV.
LAB_DATA: Rapid strep test, 3-in-1 Covid/Flu/RSV (SARS-CoV-2, Influenza, RSV by PCR, POC) test.
HISTORY: Heart Murmur when younger, premature birth, anxiety

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer (patient herself) via COVID-19 Vaccine Adverse Event Self-Reporting Solution portal. A 14-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the right arm on 17Sep2021 at the age of 14 years old (Batch/Lot Number: FC3182, Expiration date: unknown) as dose 1, single for COVID-19 immunization. The vaccination facility type was reported as the urgent care center. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient's medical history was not reported. The patient had no known allergies. There were no concomitant medications; the patient had no other medications in two weeks. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks. The patient had no covid prior vaccination and was not tested for covid post vaccination. On 24Sep2021, 1 week after first dose, grand mal seizure and hospitalization occurred. The adverse event also resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of grand mal seizure. The patient had recovered from grand mal seizure on an unspecified date.  No follow-up attempts are possible. All_symptoms: Abdominal pain upper Appendicitis Asthenia Blindness Blood test
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient received the vaccine on Monday, November 8th. She was not anxious to get the vaccine, she was excited and proud to get it. She didn't have lunch before the vaccine, but did have cereal for breakfast. Immediately after getting the vaccine (while still sitting in the chair), Patient held her head and said ""my head mommy, my head hurts so much"" and then they had her stand up and she opened her eyes wide and said ""I can't see mommy, everything is white"" and I asked the person who gave the vaccine to help. She laid patient on the ground and put her feet up. She was clammy, very pale, and still. She shivered a little as if she was cold. She laid there with tears, but awake for about 20 minutes. They brought a wheelchair and moved her to a cot. We gave her some crackers and they asked us to leave about 10 minutes later.   She was very tired following the event and for the rest of the day, but she was awake and talking and walking. On Tuesday and Wednesday, she complained of a ""bad headache"" and said her ears and her head were hot.  On Thursday she was a little pale, but didn't complain of anything. On Friday in school they sent her to the school nurse becasue she was pale and clammy and said her head hurt really bad.   On Saturday (11/13) evening, she started throwing up. She threw up and had water-diarrhea all day on Sunday. She coudn't sit up or move on her own.   I took her to a Pediatric Urgent Care on Monday (11/15), and they sent us to the Hospital Emergency Room (details below). They tested her for everything they could think of, and the only abnormal result was a positive Strep test.   Today is Thursday (11/18) and she has been at home since we left the ER on Monday, but only very slowly feeling better. She hasn't eaten much since Saturday (11/13), though she is drinking fine. She has thrown up 1-2 times each day and still feels very weak and tired. She's slept most of the day, every day. This morning is the first time she's willingly eaten a little bit. She's definitely not been herself over the past 5 days.   I'm honestly terrified to get her the second dose of the vaccine. I realize the illness could be completely unrelated to the vaccine, but I'd like to get an opinion on whether or not to get her the second dose on time, or wait a while.
LAB_DATA: The pediatric Urgent Care tested her for COVID, flu, and urinary tract infection. All were negative. They suspected that she may have appendicitis because of the severity of her vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach pain when we were in the office and sent us to the Emergency Room.   I took her directly to the ER, where they did blood tests, a strep test, an ultrasound, and gave her IV fluids. The only abnormal finding was a positive strep test and a lot of gas in her stomach. They sent her home with Amoxicillin and she has taken it 2x a day since.
HISTORY: No chronic or long-standing health conditions or concerns

He said his body hurt and that he didn't feel well. He experienced significant congestion and he told his dad that it was hard to breath. I am not sure if it was hard to breath bc of congestion or if he was having any respiratory issues. He was significantly congested for several days. Patient stayed home from school due to his symptoms for 3 days. Patient saw a doctor who thought he probably picked up a cold at the exact same time he received his first covid vaccine dose, as Patient's 3 year old brother started experiencing the same symptoms approximately 5 days after Patient received his covid vaccine. It is just strange that a cold would happen at the exact same time that a covid vaccine was received. It is possible that it was a cold, but it is also possible that Patient had pretty significant symptoms in response to the covid vaccine. I thpught it should be reported in case other people experience the same thing.

A 15-year-old non-pregnant female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRna vaccine, solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 14May2021 14:00 (at the age of 15-Years-old) (Lot Number: EW0168) as dose 1, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder) and asthma. Concomitant medication included oral dexmethylphenidate hydrochloride (FOCALIN XR ER) 15 mg daily taken for ADHD from an unspecified start date and ongoing for years. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Patient did not receive any other vaccine in 4 weeks. The patient did not have COVID prior vaccination. Patient was tested for COVID post vaccination. No known allergies were reported. No known family history illness. On 14May2021, the patient experienced fever of 103.5 - 104 for 5 days started at 23:00. It go down to 101 with Tylenol or ibuprofen. The event resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. On an unknown date in may2021, 24 hours after vaccination, the patient experienced chills/body aches. The patient was seen in the office 18May2021 and Felt to be either viral illness or immune response to vaccine. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature and showed result of 101 on an unknown date, body temperature was 103.5 -104 on 14May2021 and sars-cov-2 test (nasal swab) was negative on 19May2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of fever of 103.5 -104 for 5 days. Therapeutic measures were not taken with to chills/body ache. At the time of this report the outcome of event fever of 103.5-104 for 5 days was recovered on 19May2021 and other events recovered on an unknown date in 2021.  The Physician considered the Pfizer product had a causal effect to the adverse event.   Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected

All_symptoms: Chest pain Costochondritis Electrocardiogram PR segment depression Electrocardiogram ST segment elevation Pericarditis
SYMPTOM_TEXT: About 36 or so hours after receiving the second dose of the COVID-19 Pfizer vaccine (vaccine given 8/14/21), 14 year old male patient awoke from sleep around 1am on 8/16/21 complaining of substernal chest pain that was 8/10 in severity without any associated shortness of breath, lightheadedness, palpitations, syncope, or other symptoms. The pain improved to 3/10 with Tylenol prior to presenting to the emergency department.
LAB_DATA: He presented to the Emergency Department 8/16AM after onset of chest pain. ECG was obtained and noted ST elevation and PR depression in the inferior leads. He was given motrin for pain with complete resolution of pain within handful of hours of pain onset. Troponin level was negative/undetectable. He did not have a friction rub or tachycardia or fever at that time. He was admitted for observation and repeat troponin level was in a detectable range but still normal. He had no recurrence of pain and was discharged later that day with a diagnosis of likely vaccine induced pericarditis versus a costochondritis. He followed up in Pediatric Cardiology clinic with me MD 11/18/21 and his ECG is now normal with no ST abnormalities, also further evidence that this was likely pericarditis, and we feel likely related to his vaccine. He has been doing very well clinically throughout and asymptomatic.
HISTORY: Born with congenital Horner's Syndrome on the left. No debilitating or chronic effects from this other than left eye ptosis. No other medical conditions.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient is a 6 year old ex 28 week twin male with hx of grade 3 IVH and VP shunt  (last revised 8/2020) with recently diagnosed focal epilepsy, well controlled on Keppra.  He received his first dose of Pfizer vaccine on 11/6 around 9:30 am. The next day, dad states he c/o headache and some stomach upset.  On 11/7 in the evening, he had 1x episode of emesis just prior to bed.  After this episode, per dad, he was staring into space and not responsive.  Denies eye deviation or extremity shaking.  EMS was called and was intermittently sleepy and not back to baseline for ~1 hour.     Patient was seen initially at where he had a reassuring BMP, CBC.  They gave him his evening dose of Keppra via IV.  He was then transferred to for further management given VP shunt and concern for seizure.   No fevers, headache, diarrhea, rash, URI symptoms within the week leading up to the vaccine.   Last (and first) seizure was in January 2021.  Takes daily Keppra.  Last medication change was around March 2021.

All_symptoms: Accidental overdose Chills Decreased appetite Dizziness Electrocardiogram
SYMPTOM_TEXT: right ear drainage; overdose/the patient received all 6 doses of the pfizer-biontech covid-19 vaccine in one single dose; fever; fatigue; headache; soreness at injection site; chills; sleepy; dizziness; vomiting; decreased appetite; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other hcp and from a contactable Nurse.  A 12-years-old male patient received second dose of (BNT162B2 PFIZER BIONTECH, Solution for injection, Lot Number: FE3592; Expiration Date: 20Nov2021) Intramuscular in Left deltoid on 15Sep2021 at 09:48 for covid-19 immunisation.  The patient medical history was none. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot Number FE3592) , Intramuscular in Left deltoid on 08Aug2021 at 16:26 as single dose. On 30Jul2021 the patient had received Vaccine Gardasil 9 (Manufacture: Merck, Batch/lot#: T028582) intramuscular in left deltoid and Vaccine Energix B (Manufacture: GSK, Batch/lot#: J7H4D) intramuscular Right deltoid previous doses 2. On 15Sep2021 the day of the patient's second dose the caller stated that the patient received all 6 doses of the pfizer-biontech covid-19 vaccine in one single dose, the vaccine was diluted and they drew up the whole vial. They normally used a 1ml syringe and instead that day the new person used a 3cc (milliliters) syringe because they were in training. This allowed a larger volume to be pulled up from the vial and caused the overdose event. A multi-dose vial of a Pfizer Vaccine was given to a child of 12 years of age all in one day. The event required visit to Emergency Room. The patient complained of fever, fatigue, headache, soreness at injection site, chills, sleepy, dizziness, right ear drainage, vomiting x 1 and decreased appetite. Temporarily treatment included Tylenol, ibuprofen and cetirizine. The patient was monitored at home for 3 days. On 22Sep2021 EKG (Electrocardiogram) showed normal result. The outcome of the events was unknown.  Amendment: This follow up is being submitted to amend previously reported information: the case is serious, the event overdose is considered serious as medical significant.  Additional information received on 21Sep2021, 06Oct2021 and 07Oct2021 from a contactable nurse  includes vaccination doses details and lot numbers, past drug vaccines history, none medical history, new events (fever, fatigue, headache, soreness at injection site, chills, sleepy, dizziness, right ear drainage, vomiting x 1 and decreased appetite), treatment and EKG result.   No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information provided, a contributory role of the suspect product BNT162B2 to the reported events cannot be excluded in the setting of accidental overdose. It was noted that patient received all 6 doses of the pfizer-biontech covid-19 vaccine in one single dose. Case will be reassessed upon receipt of additional information. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.
LAB_DATA: Test Date: 20210922; Test Name: EKG; Result Unstructured Data: Test Result:Normal
HISTORY: Comments: List of non-encoded Patient Relevant History: Patient Other Relevant History 1: None

All_symptoms: Abnormal dreams Cold sweat Crying Hyperhidrosis Immediate post-injection reaction
SYMPTOM_TEXT: The child received vaccine, three seconds later, Site Manager observed the child begin to shake and raise arms in upright and locked position bent at the elbows towards face. At that time RN  was called over and began evaluating child.  RN also came over and began calming child and evaluating him. The child came to within a couple minutes and began crying and stating he did not know what just happened and stated that he had a weird dream. RN began a set of vitals on child where blood pressure was noted to be 101/88 and pulse 58, respirations 22. Child began to sweat profusely and his skin color became pallor. Child's skin was also cold and clammy to touch however child was talking and coherent, child answering questions asked of him appropriately.  EMS was called to scene and arrived at that point began asking child questions which he was answering appropriately.  His skin color and sweating improved before being transported out of facility. Child was taken to Hospital.

All_symptoms: Bronchiolitis Chest X-ray abnormal Cough Decreased appetite Fatigue
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Persistent cough was reported to pediatrician on 11/01/2021. Pediatrician saw no issue with the cough. Flu shot was administered this day.  Day of 11/18/2021 patient complained of sore throat. Persistent cough is assumed to be the reason. Patient also had a runny nose. Night of 11/18/2021 patient developed a slight fever (100.6) and had a poor night's rest.  Day of 11/19/2021 child complains of a sore throat and begins to wheeze while simultaneously breathing faster. Patient has a loss of appetite and is fatigued. An at-home COVID-19 rapid test (BinaxNOW) come back with a negative result but due to the problem being a respiratory issue, the patient is taken to the ER at Medical Center in the area.  Nasal swab shows the patient has a rhinovirus and chest x-rays show signs of bronchiolitis.  Oxygen is given to the patient. 3 doses of a respiratory treatment and 1 steroid treatment. Patient is discharged with a prescription for ALBUTEROL 90 mcg/puff inhaler + spacer (monaghan, medium-sized mask spacer) and DEXAMETHASONE (DECADRON) 1mg/mL solution.  Day of 11/20/2021, patient is breathing much easier but still has some wheezing. Coughing has brought up clear phlegm. Pediatrician is called for consultation and no additional notes given. Throat is still sore.
LAB_DATA: Nasal swab: Rhinovirus Chest X-Ray: Bronchiolitis

SYMPTOM_TEXT: I gave patient his pediatric dose around 5pm and when he was sitting in the waiting area, around 5:20pm, my technician ran over to me and told me she had an emergency and the patient is passing out. I went and assessed the situation to see if he was having a reaction or fainting and noticed he was having syncope. I raised his legs and ran to grab cold backs for his wrists, neck, and face, we gave him something to drink while I directed another technician to call 911. We stayed with the patient, he was reactive and doing okay until paramedics arrived and then we let them take over the rest.

All_symptoms: Autism spectrum disorder Dehydration Urine analysis Urine ketone body present Vomiting
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Briefly, patient presents with vomiting that 10 episodes of nonbloody nonbilious per day since receiving his first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine 48 hours ago. No fevers, diarrhea, apparent headache.     Exam (after Zofran) showed: Gen: Nontoxic appearing, no acute distress, alert and active, playing with phone; HEENT: mucus membranes dry, PERRL, EOMI, normal conjunctiva, neck supple without LAN; Card: RRR, no murmur, good perfusion; Lungs: CTAB, good air entry, no increased WOB; Abd: soft, non-tender, non-distended, no masses; Ext: warm and well perfused, moving all extremities; Skin: no rashes; GU: Testes do not appear to swollen, tender to palpation, and have normal cremasteric reflex bilaterally     Symptoms likely due to post vaccine reaction versus viral illness with component of gastroenteritis. Less likely appendicitis or other concerning intraabdominal pathology given benign abdominal exam. Do not suspect increased ICP given normal neuro exam and lack of apparent HA.  GU exam is reassuring against hernia or torsion as etiology.  Given age, UTI is less likely but discussed with family and obtained urinalysis which was reassuring against UTI, ketones likely due to dehydration.  Covid swab and rapid strep sent, strep negative, COVID pending.  Given Zofran and PO challenged tolerated multiple glasses of water without vomiting. Patient safe for discharge to home with supportive care and PCP follow up, prescribed short course of zofran in case of ongoing vomiting. Family in agreement with plan and verbalize understanding of signs and symptoms to return to care. Final Diagnosis  1. Vomiting R11.10 2. Dehydration E86.0 3. Autism spectrum disorder F84.9
LAB_DATA: UA negative except for large ketones (160) Throat culture, Group A strep - negative SARS CoV-s PCR, Resp, Qual - negative

All_symptoms: Chest pain Electrocardiogram
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Heart/chest pain started on November 11 in the evening. Resolved after 10 minutes. Pediatrician said to monitor and call if it occurs again. Chest pain started a second time on November 14. Pediatrician advised to go to the ER. ER did an EKG which came back normal. ER doc ruled out serious outcomes like aneurysm, heart attack and anything related to Kawasaki disease (which he had in 2017). He continued to have chest pain into the next day (November 15). It resolved at 2:30pm, but returned around 6:30pm and resolved by the next morning. Follow up with pediatrician the next day. They believed chest pain was not related to the vaccine because it was outside of the 24 hour window and felt it was more likely costochondritis. He had one more incident of chest pain on November 16 around 2:30pm and resolved by 3pm. Asked cardiology to schedule an echocardiogram, but have not heard from them yet and don't see much of a reason if chest pain has resolved.
LAB_DATA: EKG - normal (November 14)

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient developed R inguinal adenopathy (1cm x 2) on 11/13/21.  On 11/14/21 she developed an erythematous papular rash on the R lower extremity and a few similar lesions on her chest and back.  Was seen by urgent care and told rash were bites.  Was seen at on  11/15 CBC, BMP, CRP drawn, all WNL.  The lesions on her legs became purpuric on 11/19/21.  Seen again at on 11/22, inguinal adenopathy decreasing in size, labs repeated including UA which showed microscopic hematuria.  At no time did she have fever.  No abdominal pain, no joint pain, no headache, no itching. BP 93/62--normal   Given lower extremity rash and microscopic hematuria, we are calling this HSP but it is a very soft diagnosis.  The feeling is that this is vaccine related, whether it be HSP or just a purpuric rash.

All_symptoms: Chest discomfort Dyspnoea Headache
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Approximately 30 minutes after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine, my daughter started experiencing trouble getting a good breath. She was taking lots of deep breaths and holding her chest area. She said it felt tight like she couldn't breathe right. About 10 minutes later, she had a headache. She seemed very uncomfortable. I took her back to the hospital where she received the COVID-19 vaccine and they immediately walked us to the ER. Her blood pressure and oxygen levels checked immediately before taken back to a room. A doctor came in and suggested trying some Benadryl and just watching/monitoring her. About 30 minutes after receiving Benadryl, her headache subsided. Within an hour, her breathing was much easier. She was monitored for a total of 4 hours. During that time, her blood pressure was checked periodically and oxygen levels monitored.
LAB_DATA: Blood pressure and oxygen levels.
HISTORY: Connective tissue disease, angioid streaks (right eye), unruptured brain aneurysm, heart surgery at 1 year old.

All_symptoms: Alanine aminotransferase increased Antibody test Aspartate aminotransferase increased Bacterial test Blood alkaline phosphatase increased
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient became febrile on 11/17/21 and developed bright erythematous rash that was worse at creases. She was treated with PO amoxicillin due to presumed scarlet fever. She continued to be febrile and rash became maculopapular throughout body. She was seen in ED on 11/21 and had labs that showed slightly elevated liver enzymes and UA showed pyuria without any UTI symptoms. She was tested for mononucleosis and negative. She was given Rocephin IM in ED and switched to cephalexin as physician concerned rash was from mononucleosis. She then continued to fever and developed conjunctivitis. Patient was admitted to Pediatric Floor on 11/23 to rule out MIS-C but on day of admission CBC and inflammatory markers were nearly normal with downtrending LFTs. She was started on doxycycline to treat murine typhus as it is endemic in the region and Rocephin empirically while awaiting cultures. She has been afebrile since admission on 11/23 and had a normal ECHO by cardiology.

All_symptoms: Fatigue Gingival swelling Pain Swelling face
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient's mother relates that patient got her 1st COVID vaccine on Thursday, 11/18/2021, along with her other siblings. On Friday, 11/19/2021, she was feeling tired and achy and she gave her a dose of Ibuprofen. Then on Saturday, 11/20/2021, patient woke up with swelling to the right side of her face and her upper gums. Patient's mother called and spoke with a provider at a prompt care and was encouraged to bring patient to an ER. Patient was brought to the ED on 11/20/21 after giving her a dose of Benadryl at home. Patient's mother relates that patient was discharged from the ED with instructions to continue Benadryl and cool compresses. The ED notes state that patient had minimal swelling to the right eyelid and the upper gums and had no swelling to the tongue, lips, or pharynx and was  not having any difficulty with breathing. Patient's mother relates that patient is doing better and has not had to have any Benadryl since Sunday, 11/21/2021.
LAB_DATA: None

Another referral for stress test/further diagnosis to hospital, details TBA once available.

All_symptoms: Acute respiratory distress syndrome Chest X-ray normal Cough Respiratory syncytial virus infection Stridor
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Acute respiratory distress consistent with RSV. Went to Urgent Treatment Center as condition was worsening. Patient showed stridor.  No RSV test was given, and the doctor assumed RSV because he had received his COVID vaccine and had a history of croup. 16mL intramuscular dexamethasone injection was given, symptoms subsided within an hour and disappeared by the start of the next day.  He received the second Pfizer dose on the 23rd, and eight hours later showed the same coughing and stridor approximately eight hours later, with acute symptoms. We went to the same Urgent Treatment Center where he received albuterol sulfate via nebulizer, and oral dexamethasone of the same dosage. The Urgent Treatment Center referred us to the Emergency Room. We traveled to Hospital where he received two breathing treatments of racemic epinephrine. His symptoms did not subside, but because O2 and heart rate were stable for the duration of the time that we were there - even when he slept - they sent us home. He awoke with the stridor gone and with no further symptoms.
LAB_DATA: Chest X-Ray (Hospital, 11/23/2021) - normal

Ready to start CPR and patient woke, very diaphoretic and pale. Took time to recover. At that time temp 100.6. No other signs of illness. All_symptoms: Abdominal pain upper Impaired work ability Nausea Pain
SYMPTOM_TEXT: 14yr old female arrived to ED with complaints of stomach pain which started about 2 hours ago at work. She had to leave work because the pain was too bad. Rates pain 10/10. She has not taken anything for the pain. Pain is located in upper abdomin, constant ache. States she feels nauseated. Had a bowel movement this afternoon, normal for her. She also started her menstrual cycle 3 days ago.  ASSESSMENT/PLAN/DECISION MAKING:   Epigastric Pain   Zofran ODT, nausea improved.     GI cocktail, pain improved.     Observed  For about 30 minutes in the ED,  bowel sounds were reassessed and were normal.     Autonomic dysfunction addressed with osteopathic manipulation : HVLA to thoracic spine.     Administered omeprazole 20 mg in the ED , prescribed Prilosec CP DR twice daily before meals.   She is advised to push fluids.    She is to follow-up with NP at GI office, as EGD and possible impedance study were proposed.    Given body habitus consideration should be given to investigation for Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient began to experience headaches on 10/29 about 2 weeks after administration of the second COVID19 vaccine. He was admitted to the hospital. Labs and imaging obtained. Head imaging showed sphenoid sinusitis. MRI/MRA showing suspected left greater than right cavernous sinus thrombosis, likely secondary to sphenoid sinusitis, with associated mild narrowing of the left cavernous internal carotid artery. Patient started on anticoagulation and discharged home on anticoagulation. He also went to the OR on 11/21 for sphenoidotomy and drainage of fluid. Cavernous sinus thrombosis likely secondary to sphenoid sinusitis but because of the timing of second vaccine consulted ID who recommended submitting VAERS form and sending platelet factor 4 antibody- still pending.
LAB_DATA: Platelet Factor 4 antibody pending

SYMPTOM_TEXT: swollen lymph nodes (lymphadenopathy)/swollen lymph nodes under her under arm/whole time in her neck; Discomfort pain; sharp stabbing pains in upper left quadrant/body aches; Abdominal pain; pain in her head, neck, and abdomen; vomiting; congestion; Upper respiratory symptoms; fatigue/Chronic fatigue; fever; chills; headache/headaches every day/most time its in front but it has also been in the back of her head, its throbbing and pounding pain/ On good day the patient's headache pain is 5/10/ bad day its 10/10; coughing; sore throat; body shake; lost 7 pounds; sedimentary rate is running high; white blood cell count is high; 2 Rash situations where she started running a fever and developed a rash, neck, and chest.; The patient's Fibrinogen was really low on the last test.; lower abdominal pain - achy/lower center of her abdomen which is more achey/doubled over laying in the floor; upper abdominal pain - tender to touch and sharp sometimes/upper left quadrant which is tender to touch and at times has stabbing pains there/doubled over laying in the floor; inflammation throughout her body; This is a spontaneous report from two contactable consumers (patient's parents). A 15-year-old female (reporter's daughter) patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm on 05Jun2021 (Lot Number: ER8734) at age of 15-year-old as DOSE 2, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation.  There was no medical history. There were no concomitant medications. Historical vaccine included 1st dose of bnt162b2 (lot number: ER8731) on 15May2021 in arm at age of 15-year-old for covid-19 immunisation. After 1st dose, she experienced respiratory symptoms and went to the pediatrics office on 17May2021. Respiratory symptoms included sore throat, coughing, blood tinged mucus when she coughed. These symptoms lasted a few days then the patient was fine. On the evening of 05Jun2021 the night after she got her 2nd dose, she had fever, chills, body aches, headache, coughing, sore throat, fatigue that lasted longer than the 1st dose. Their daughter experienced chronic fatigue, she was wiped out and that's unusual for her this happened the month of June to July. On 23Aug2021, she had vomiting, headache, fatigue and body aches again. The side effects come and go since August, there's spike of fever every now and then. Their daughter also keeps having 2 kinds of abdominal pain, lower abdominal pain - achy, upper abdominal pain - tender to touch and sharp sometimes and was showing inflammation throughout her body. Caller also added that they've been to all kinds of tests for their daughter's discomfort pain, swollen lymph nodes (lymphadenopathy) but it's not going away, their daughter also went to ET on 2 separate occasions and was also hospitalized at one point for 3 days. The patient was in hospital for Abdominal pain: 27Oct2021 to 29Oct2021. Additionally, the patient was having all kinds of strange things happen. The patient has seen multiple doctors, been to urgent care, the emergency room and admitted to the hospital for three days. The patient has had every test done. The patient had lost 7 pounds. The patient was athletic but she was losing weight. The evening of 05Jun2021, the patient had fever, chills, body shake, headache, coughing, sore throat, and fatigue which all lasted longer than after the first dose. The patient was feeling fatigued pretty much all summer and the caller thought it was because the patient was working with her husband but now the caller was thinking its from the vaccine.   On 21Aug2021 when things started up again and hasn't gone away since. On 21Aug2021 the patient had a sore throat, congestion, and upper respiratory symptoms. The patient was tested for covid and strep as part of the rule out. The patient went to her pediatrician on 23Aug2021. 7 days later the patient wasn't improving and went back to the pediatrician because she was vomiting, had a headache, fatigue, and body aches going on. Since all of this started in August the caller doesn't know what symptoms will show up for the day in the patient. The patient has had fevers off and on, vomiting off and on. The patient has had swollen lymph nodes the whole time in her neck. The patient had a biopsy of the lymph nodes done. The doctors have ruled out a bunch of stuff but doesn't know what's going on with the patient but is thinking it s the vaccine. The patient also has swollen lymph nodes under her under arm and abdominal pain. The patient has had two different types of abdominal pain- one in the lower center of her abdomen which is more achey and then one in the upper left quadrant which is tender to touch and at times has stabbing pains there. The patient has headaches every day, most of the time its in the front but it has also been in the back of her head, its a throbbing and pounding pain. On a good day the patient's headache pain is 5/10 but on a bad day its 10/10. The caller has been tracking the patient's pain in her head, neck, and abdomen since 15Oct2021. Investigations: The patient has seen and ENT, rheumatologist, hematologist, infectious disease, and a neuro ophthalmologist. The patient has had CT scans- 2 of her neck and head and 2 of her abdomen. The second CT scan of the patient's abdomen was also and angio. The doctors were trying to rule out an abscess of the patient's tonsils. They did an MRI of the patient's head, neck, and brain to rule out tumors. They did an echo, EKG, ultrasound of the patient's abdomen, ultrasound of the patient's chest, a chest and neck x-ray. The patient has had blood work, every test. 80 tubes of blood has taken on the patient over the course of this time. The lab work showed that the patient's inflammation markers are elevated. The patient's C reactive protein was 2.1. The doctors are trying to figure out what is going on that doesn't fit into a category of anything particular. The patient's sedimentary rate is running high, her white blood cell count is high, CB19 cells are high, CD8T cells are high. Investigations: The patient's inflammatory markers have been elevated- platelets, C reactive proteins, sedimentary rate, RDW and everything that shows extreme inflammation has been elevated the whole time. The one phase the patient went through she had high white blood cell counts. None of the patient's labs have been sky high but they have been consistently elevated. The patient has had lymphadenopathy in her neck. The pain sensations in the patient's abdomen and lymph nodes, they haven't been able to pinpoint all of this. The doctor mentioned that they have seen a couple of patients with spleenitis but that was not seen on the patient's CT scans. The patient had 2 Rash situations where she started running a fever and developed a rash, neck, and chest. At first the caller thought it was a reaction to the Azithromycin antibiotic that she took. The patient only took one tablet and the doctor told her to stop taking them. The patient hadn't had a rash until today where she spiked a fever last couple of days. The rash was from the patient's neck and everywhere. The patient is not currently on any medications.  The immune mediated reaction is going on through the patient's body. The patient had a biopsy of the lymph nodes because they were afraid it was cancer. The biopsy showed CD4 and CD8 immunoglobulins had double negative receptors and the doctors were concerned about a particular HELPS but the patient was negative. Those markers are supposed to be about 10% and the patient's was at 6 % so they were checking that for awhile but it was negative. The patient's biopsy was negative for infection and cancer. Since this started, the patient has had a low grade but big immunological reaction. When all of this happened they were in and out of the pediatrician's office. The abdominal pain was bad and one night the patient was doubled over laying in the floor. The patient is tough and it takes a lot for her to get like this. The patient went to the emergency room that night, 30Sep2021, and stayed over night. The patient came home and they did more tests. The patient ended back in the emergency room again on 07Oct2021, and stayed 2 nights. This happened 6-8 weeks into this. Dr. (withheld) has been calling and speaking with the hematologist and running all of these tests. The patient's Fibrinogen was really low on the last test.  On 15Oct2021 the patient went into the emergency room during the day and was discharged and was back later that night because of the fever and abdominal pain. They were there over night that night and left after 7 am on 16Oct2021. On 19Oct2021 the patient had her lymph node biopsy. The patient was hospitalized 27Oct2021 until 29Oct2021 because of the sharp stabbing pains in upper left quadrant. Azithromycin- Lot and NDC unknown. Expiration date 15Oct2022. The patient only took one dose. The outcome of events sharp stabbing pains in upper left quadrant/body aches, swollen lymph nodes, Discomfort pain, fatigue, fever, chill, headache, coughing, sore throat, vomiting and neck pain   was not recovered. The outcome of rash was recovered. The outcome of other events was unknown.

All_symptoms: Abdominal pain lower Asthenia Balance disorder Dizziness Dysarthria
SYMPTOM_TEXT: 1715: Patient noted ""dizziness"" about 15 minutes post-injection. Denied respiratory distress. No abnormal skin presentations noted, oral mucosa moist, pink, no swelling noted. Patient B/P 95/77, HR 76, O2 sat 99%  on room air, lung sounds clear throughout. Bilateral grips weak, appeared to be trembling.   1718: Patient recline with legs elevated, took deep breaths and coughed. c/o worsening dizziness. Denied nausea. Temp 98.7  1730: Pt noted her throat felt tight and it was ""hard to swallow."" Pt stated it was ""getting harder to take a breath.""   No respiratory distress noted, lung sounds clear throughout, O2 sat 99% on RA. Nurse notified on-call physician, prepared to activate emergency response. Mother declined emergency intervention, patient stated she could ""breathe fine"" and stated her throat was not as tight as previously reported.  1745: Pt attempted to stand, legs began to shake and patient appeared unable to bear weight or walk. Nurse and mother assisted patient to sit.  Patient exhibited  slurred, slow speech. Pt eyes closed and head fell forward. When pt roused, she c/o headache, fatigue, and moderate to severe LLQ pain that was tender to palpation. Pt guarding (L) ABD. Temp 99.5. B/P 125/80, HR 80,  O2 sat 98% on RA, lung sounds remained clear throughout.   Nurse initiated emergency response.   1800: When EMT's arrived, pt was able yto ambulate with assistance, appeared weak, unsteady but able to bearweight. Pt A+O x 4. Mother accompanied patient to ambulance.  NOTE: Patient mother noted unusual tiredness and lethargy ""over the last 2 days. It has been hard to wake her (patient) up.""  Patient c/o intermittent stomach pain, LLQ, over past two days. Current nausea and headache.
LAB_DATA: Unknown

All_symptoms: Angina pectoris Blood test Chest X-ray normal Chest pain Crying
SYMPTOM_TEXT: My woke me up at 2:30 a.m. clutching his chest, crying out in pain, saying, ?Mommy, my heart is hurting!? He couldn?t take a deep breath because of the pain. In addition, he reported severe body pain and was sobbing! I rushed him to the ER, where they did a cardiac work-up, which was unremarkable (I.e., no signs of myocarditis or pericarditis). He was given Tylenol and Ibuprofen, which helped reduce the pain. He?s had to have around the clock Tylenol and Ibuprofen since that time to cope with pain. As of last night he seemed to be feeling better and he was able to take deep breaths without pain. I have never seen my son this symptomatic from any illness or vaccine in his entire life! As an aside, he had side effects following the first dose (I.e., body pain, low grade fever, lethargy, loss of appetite). We have a follow-up with his pediatrician today.
LAB_DATA: Chest x-ray EKG  Physical exam Blood work: CBC, CMP, tryponin (sp?)

All_symptoms: Blood pressure decreased Headache Heart rate decreased Nausea Pallor
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient is a 14 year old female brought in by mother for COVID Vaccination, dose # 1 of the Pfizer BioNTech vaccine under emergency use authorization.   Screening Prior to Vaccination: Is there a current illness or fever? No Has the patient ever had a severe (anaphylactic) reaction to any trigger? No Has the patient had a severe (anaphylactic) reaction to any vaccine or vaccine component? No Has the patient ever had myocarditis? no Does the patient have a bleeding disorder or use a blood thinner? no Is the patient immunocompromised? no For Females: Is the patient pregnant, planning to become pregnant or breast feeding? No Has the patient ever fainted from a vaccination? no Has the patient received a COVID vaccination before? No  Patient Assessment Patient's temperature is 97.5 degrees, taken by contactless forehead method. Consent Verbal informed consent was obtained by parent. . Monitoring and Discharge Patient was monitored for 15 minutes following vaccination. There were any reactions. The patient was noted to have nausea and pallor 10 minutes after vaccine administration.. The patient required brief rest in supine position and epinephrine. Additional details about the reaction: see below.  Patient received her first dose of the covid vaccine around 2:15pm. Approximately 5-10 minutes later, patient's mother alerted the nurse that patient was experiencing nausea. Nurse followed mother to the bathroom where patient was kneeling on the floor in front of the toilet. Patient was extremely pale, shaky, and complaining of nausea. Nurse brought patient water, a chair to sit in, and took her pulse and oxygen level with pulse oximeter machine. Pulse ox was in 97-99% range, and heart rate was in the upper 90s. Due to the patient's ill appearance, nurse went to get a BP cuff and alerted physician of the situation as she was getting one. Physician arrived in the bathroom. Nurse took BP- 110/72 at this time. Physician did a physical exam of patient and instructed nurse to have patient lie down with feet elevated and monitor her. Nurse took patient back to the exam room, laid her in supine position, elevated feet with a pillow, and left the room for approximately another 4-5 minutes.   Mother again alerted nurse that pulse oximeter machine was beeping, and nurse returned to room. Patient was still complaining of nausea and appeared very pale. Patients pulse was in the 50s and low 60s, and her pulse ox was holding stead at 97-99% range. Nurse took a manual heart rate with stethoscope to verify accuracy of pulse oximeter machine- 60bpm. Nurse took BP again- 92/62. Nurse alerted physician.  Physician came to exam room, examined patient. Patient was still complaining of severe nausea. Patient was still extremely pale. Physician BP- 98/58. HR still in 50s and 60s.  Decision was made by physician to give 0.3mg of epinephrine to patient and call 911. Nurse alerted front office staff to call 911. Nurse drew up 0.3mg of epi, dose was verified by physician and second nurse. Nurse administered 0.3mg of epi to patient at 2:49pm.  Ambulance arrived approximately 5 minutes later.  Ambulance team took over monitoring patient vitals. Ambulance team advised mom that if she went to the hospital she would just have to wait and then be sent home. Mom requested to speak with physician, who advised mom that patient needed to go to the hospital for monitoring. After physician left the room, ambulance team member told mom that she had worked at the hospital, and she knew that the care patient would receive at the hospital would not be different than the care elsewhere. Nurse communicated with mom that physician recommended patient be taken via ambulance to be seen at the hospital as she had a serious allergic reaction to the COVID vaccine, and she needs to be under observation.  Discussed option to be monitored at hospitals' urgent care versus ER to save on cost.  Mom was concerned about the cost of an expensive ambulance ride, and she ultimately opted to drive to an alternate hospital (across the street from the office) against the advice of the physician and nurse.  Nurse advised mom that she needed to drive immediately to the alternate hospital. Instructed mom that if patient deteriorated in the car to call 911 immediately. Mom agreed.  At the time of patient leaving, she was still complaining of nausea. She was no complaining of headache as well. Color had improved. Blood pressure was up, 110s over 70s. Heart rate was still in 60s.   Immediately after patient left nurse notified physician of mom's decision to drive to alternate hospital. Note: Epinephrine Lot #: 27670 Epinephrine Expiration Date: 09/2022 Administered in left vastus lateralis muscle  - Nurse  --- Agree with above.  Initially, felt reaction was likely vasovagal response to vaccine (although had not occurred for her with prior vaccines/bloodwork).  No wheezing, difficulty breathing, cough, or rash.  Timing seemed prolonged for a vasovagal event and was worsening over 30 minutes of monitoring.  Due decreasing BP, decreasing HR (although lower than her norm based on prior vitals- not tachycardic), poor perfusion, pallor, headache, and persistent nausea- even after laying down with feet elevated, drinking water, resting, and monitoring, decided to give epi for possible allergic reaction and send to the ER for monitoring.  Per mom, patient was monitored at a hospital.  ER doctor felt most likely a vasovagal response rather than anaphylactic reaction.  She is doing better.  Physician  Assessment Need for vaccination   Plan Orders COVID-19 – 8/12/2021 Admin COVID dose 1 – 8/12/2021 Instructions Pfizer BioNTech fact sheet given and reviewed. Side effects listed on the fact sheet include allergic reactions (severe and non severe), myocarditis, pericarditis, injection site pain and/or swelling, fatigue, fever, chills, muscle pain, headache. Signs of myocarditis for which to call include chest pain, palpitations or fluttering or pounding heart, shortness of breath. Call or seek emergency care if these signs occur.

All_symptoms: Acute kidney injury Anticoagulant therapy Asthma Blood creatinine increased Blood immunoglobulin G
SYMPTOM_TEXT: 12yoM with history of asthma who presented 10/4/21 with respiratory failure and newly diagnosed cardiac dysfunction. Per outside report, he initially presented Wednesday September 29th with fever, cough, shortness of breath, and malaise. He was seen in local ED and diagnosed with strep throat. He was started on augmentin. He was sent home but returned to ER several times for similar symptoms over the next few days. He also developed rash and conjunctivitis. He continued to have daily fevers up to 105F. Today he presented to outside ED with similar symptoms and respiratory distress. He was initially treated as an asthma exacerbation and received steroids, albuterol and duonebs. He also received unasyn and azithromycin for possible pneumonia on CXR. He was admitted to PICU. Due to increased respiratory distress he was placed on BiPAP. However, he continued to have sats in 80's so was intubated after receiving roc/ketamine. He was sedated with fentanyl, precedex, and received vec. He had 4 beat run of VT. Echo was obtained which showed decreased biventricular dysfunction with LVEF ~ 25%. COVID swab negative. RIJ was placed. Art line attempted but was unsuccessful. He was noted to have lower blood pressures with systolics in 80's so was started on epi at 0.01. Stable on transport with sats in 90's. He received COVID vaccine on 8/30/21 and 9/21/21 (do not have lot number available, not found in our database). Of note his sister had COVID 9/9/21 so likely he was infected and primed for MISC before he was fully vaccinated. On admission +paraflu/rsv/covid, Cn 38. Our multidisc MISC team agreed upon confirmed MISC, reported to SC DHEC. We sent nucleocapsid IgG to Mayo,  which was pos. He received IVIG, methylprednisolone, LMWH, ASA. He is still being followed by nephrology for his AKI, cardiology, and rheum. Last EF 59% on 10/19/21.

The nurse and myself assessed the patient who was diaphoretic, lethargic. At time of assessment it 1731  was noted  that patient was tachycardic, had thready radial pulse and the nurse observed her eyes roll back in her head and would not respond to verbal stimuli. 911 was called. Patient regained full consciousness  and was moved out of the Cafeteria area to a calmer location. Mother stated that child had not eaten recently and was given a bottle of orange juice. After consuming the orange juice, child seemed to ""perk back up"" and stated that she felt a little better.  Ambulance squad arrived and transported child

All_symptoms: Acute kidney injury Airway peak pressure increased Asthenia Back pain Bradycardia
SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient received Pfizer vaccine in 8/2021. In 9/2021 she began to have some vague complaints of upper back pain. Patient ultimately diagnosed with epitheliod sarcoma. Parents requested that this information be sent to VAERS in case her cancer was related to Vaccine. Physicians caring for the child do not feel her death or her cancer was related to the covid vaccine. Presented to the local Medical Center on 10/30/21 after having received care closer to home. Pt is a 13 y.o. female with no past medical history who presents with fever, chest pain, and diarrhea. About two weeks PTA, she began complaining of sternal chest pain. She had fatigue and sore throat so was taken to an urgent care where she was negative for strep, flu, and COVID. She was prescribed bromfed. She then progressed to a dry mild that started about 10 days PTA. On Tuesday, 10/26, she was seen at an outside ER and was diagnosed with pneumonia. She was started on azithromycin and augmentin. She has continued to have chest pain, SOB, and fatigue. The day of presentation, she stayed home from school. She developed nonbloody diarrhea, tachycardia, and weakness so she was taken back to the ER for evaluation. Found to have a pericardial friction rub. Admitted to hospitalist service.
LAB_DATA: Admitted to local HCF 10/30/21. See the following  from her death note summary related to hospital course: Pt is a 13 y.o. female admitted for Left atrial mass and has been hospitalized for 30 days.   she had her left atrial mass resection on 11/11/21, pericardial window creation, and mediastinal exploration with debridement.  Her mass continued to grow and increase in size and Rhee invading the left atrium and possibly the right atrium along with creation of tamponade physiology on the ventricles.  She was started on chemotherapy by hematology team, Nephrology team started her her on CRRT since she developed acute kidney injury along was multi organ failure and severe lactic acidosis.  Patient was on multiple inotropics support with progressively increasing inotropics support epinephrine up to 0.3 micrograms/kilogram per minute, norepinephrine up to 0.3 micrograms/kilogram per minute along with 2 milliunits per kg per minute vasopressin.  Over the past 48 hours prior to patient staff she was getting multiple fluid boluses and she was few L positive every day with severe 3rd spacing and progressively worsening cardiac output.   She has had evidence of progressive tamponade physiology despite aggressive chemotherapy.   she remained intubated and sedated with extremely high lung peak pressures and very poor compliance with severe pulmonary edema.  On 12/1/2021 family expressed the wishes of stop giving fluids to her since she looks very edematous, parents understand that this will lead to cardiac arrest and ending her life within the next few hours, father expressed he is willing to do everything for her but he wants to end her suffering, mom and dad were at the bedside, IV fluid replacement was stopped.  Patient vasopressin was weaned along with other inotropic support, family agreed on extubating the patient so that they can spend some time with her prior to the off.  Patient continue to progressively having low cardiac output, hypotension and bradycardia, time of death was 7:00 a.m..
